title: Add support for Hermit OS.
body: the impl in getrand: https://github.com/rust-random/getrandom/blob/master/src/hermit.rs

title: build.rs: Override fewer C compiler flags
body: See individual commit messages for details.

title: wasm32: Enable more tests and clarify `rand` logic
body: See the individual commit messages for details.

title: Use small Curve25519 for wasm32 & other non-{aarch64,x86_64}.
body:
Enable `ring::agreement` for wasm32 targets using the small implementation of Curve25519.

Use the small Curve25519 implementation of Curve25519 (and P-256) for all targets except for Aarch64 and x86-64.

Besides being smaller, the small implementations are likely more resistant to compiler-introduced side-channels, which is especially important for the wasm32 virtual machine and other targets that we don't QA as thoroughly as AAarch64 and x86-64.

Bring in the previously-removed definition of `fe_mul_llt` from BoringSSL as of commit
8d71d244c0debac4079beeb02b5802fde59b94bd.

title: Adapt tests to work for wasm32-wasi and add wasm32-wasi to CI.
body:
This is based on PR #1568. See the commit message of the first commit for details. Basically I squashed all the commits together from @JanKaul's PR, removed the changes to `build.rs`, and the GitHub Actions configuration, and rebased onto `main`.

For the CI integration, [ring-toolchain](https://github.com/briansmith/ring-toolchain) was updated to include wasmtime for x86-64 Linux. That is used to install wasmtime in CI.

title: CI: Don't test benchmarks in `test` and `test-features` jobs.
body:
Benchmarks require Rust 1.65 or later currently due to benchmark-only dependencies.

Also, benchmarks add a lot of downloading/build time because they have many more dependencies. So, skipping them in these jobs makes them faster.

title: Rearrange warning configuration
body: See the individual commits for details. The goal here is to improve the IDE and edit-test cycle experience.

title: NFC: Reduce clippy lint overrides.
body: See individual commits. This is a step towards moving Clippy configuration to clippy.toml.

title: Remove `target-dir` workaround for Clippy cache issues.
body:
For a long while this hasn't been needed. See
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#rust-152

title: Bump dependency requirements to what's been tested.
body: Older versions may work but we've not been testing those old versions.

title: ChaCha20 Polyfill: Remove `ChunksFixedMut`.
body: It is only used in one place so it isn't justified.

title: Take some steps toward eliminating the last `unsafe` in `ring::polyfill`
body:
Replace a few uses of `ChunksFixed` with a new `ArraySplitMap`. `ArraySplitMap` avoids the need to construct an intermediate array; we would hope the optimizer would handle that, but at least in the past it did not always do so.

The approach here isn't very scalable since the source code of each implementation of `ArraySplitMap`  grows twice as fast as the size of the input array. Maybe we can find a cleverer solution, at least for the larger ones.

title: AEAD: Remove all use of `ring::endian` and u64 from `Block`.
body:
In particular, eliminate the use of `ArrayEncoding::as_byte_array` as we work towards removing that function because it uses `unsafe`.

 Where `Block` is used in parameters to C/assembly code, I verified that the C/assembly code uses `uint8_t *` as the function type (meaning `uint8_t[16]`) in the BoringSSL headers. Until recently the stuff in GCM was using `uint64_t` or a union containing `uint64_t`, which is why block was previously defined in terms of `BigEndian<u64>`.

title: AES-GCM: Move `u64` <-> `Block` conversions out of `Block` and into callers
body: These are all steps towards removing the use of `BigEndian<u64>` within `Block`, and thus removing the use of `ring::endian` from `Block`. The new code doesn't use `ring::endian`.

title: Remove use of `ring::endian` from `aead::chacha20_poly1305_openssh`.
body: This is a step towards removing `ArrayEncoding::as_byte_array()`.

title: Remove `LittleEndian` usage from Poly1305 and delete `LittleEndian`.
body:
This is a step towards eliminating `unsafe` usage in `ring::endian` by eliminating one use of `ArrayEncoding::as_byte_array`.

Since this is the only usage of `LittleEndian`, it is removed completely.

This simple `array_flatten` polyfill will be useful for multiple improvements towards eliminating the unsafe code in `endian`.

title: NFC: Safety: Remove `endian::FromByteArray`.
body: Remove one `unsafe` from `ring::endian` by completely removing `FromByteArray`.

title: Improve compatibility with older versions of GCC/Clang
body: See the individual commit messages for details.

title: Use `CRYPTO_memcmp` name the same as BoringSSL.
body:
*ring* defined a function named `OPENSSL_memcmp` that did what `CRYPTO_memcmp` does in BoringSSL, and BoringSSL has a different function called `OPENSSL_memcmp`. *ring* doesn't need `OPENSSL_memcmp` so sync the `CRYPTO_memcmp` stuff with BoringSSL.

This eliminates unnecessary differences from BoringSSL.

title: Curve25519: Conservatively force noinline on ADX code paths.
body: See https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/116573.

title: build.rs: Remove `-fno-strict-aliasing` from the C compiler configuration.
body: Enable further compiler optimizations.

title: build.rs: Remove `-pedantic-errors` from compiler configuration.
body: Our policy is to set warnings-as-errors only when buildingt from Git, not when building from a packaged release. This flag is another aspect of warnings-as-errors.

title: Tests: Remove superfluous uses of `libstd` in tests.
body: These tests don't require libstd functionality, so don't use libstd.

title: CI: Improve feature testing.
body:
`dev_urandom_fallback` presently does nothing, so don't bother adding it as a matrix dimension.

Because `dev_urandom_fallback` does nothing,
`--no-default-features --features=alloc` is effectively the same as the default feature set, so don't add it as a matrix dimension.

`--all-features` is no longer appropriate after the ARM hardware feature disabling features were added, so replace it with what we really want, `--features=std,slow_tests`.

In the coverage section, `--features=alloc,dev_urandom_fallback,std` is the same as `--features=std` since `alloc and `urandom_fallback` are default features.

title: Move benchmarks to a new `ring-bench` crate.
body: Move the Criterion.rs dependency out of *ring* into a new `ring-benches` crate. This speeds up many build scenerios by eliminating a bunch of dependencies from *ring*'s dependency tree for `cargo test`.

title: Remove `#![doc(html_root_url)]`.
body: Documentation isn't hosted on briansmith.org anymore.
This is 0.17.1 with one addition to Cargo.toml to add a header file that wasn't listed.

title: CI: Use `fail-fast: false` for coverage jobs.
body: Frequently lately one coverage job has been failing per job. Instead of re-running the whole matrix again, make it so we just need to run the (usually) one job that failed.

title: CI: Remove s390x and powerpc64le from `test` matrix.
body: They are still in `coverage`.

title: Remove doc/link-to-readme.md.
body: The intended effect was to redirect people reading about *ring* on crates.io to the GitHub-hosted README.md. However, the unintended effect was that docs.rs is broken for the 0.17.0 release.

title: build.rs: Use cc-rs in a more canonical way in most cases.
body: See individual commit comments. The intent here is to help people understand what's required to adapt build.rs to an alternative build system by making its use of cc-rs more idiomatic.

title: build.rs: Use `OsStr`/`OsString` more to handle non-Unicode paths.
Clarify build.rs C compiler and linker configuration.
body: See each individual commit message for details.

title: build.rs: Set compiler C and CPP (preprocessor) flags in one place.
body:
Apparently it is OK to set `-std=c1x` even when compiling assembly code, so just set it no matter what we're compiling. This simplifies the code and allows future simplification.

It's not clear why certain warnings were separated from the others. Combine them too, for the same reasons.

title: Fix powerpc64 detection
body: Both powerpc64 and powerpc define `__powerpc__`. Also remove endianness check for powerpc64* since it's not necessary.

title: NFC: Reduce scope of `#[allow(unused_variables)]` in X25519.
Don't hard-code use of static CRT in GitHub Actions AArch64 Windows build.
Add apple tvos support
body:
This PR allows using ring lib to target [tier 3 *-apple builds](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/rustc/platform-support/apple-tvos.html):

- Apple tvOS on aarch64
- Apple tvOS Simulator on x86_64

title: Enable FE25519_ADX Curve25519 implementation on x86-64.
body: When merging BoringSSL 43f88915f97d1f7df489b4b706afdfa556ba2050 I brought in the source files but I did not hook them up since some non-trivial build system and Rust source changes were necessary. Make those changes so we can use the new implementation.

title: CI: Remove PowerPC and s390x jobs from test-features. Add PowerPC to test.
body: Add the powerpc-unknown-linux-gnu target to `test`. Remove PowerPC and s390x targets from `test-features` because they slow down CI too much.

title: ECC: Better encapsulate Curve25519 base point multiplication.
body: Combine some `unsafe` blocks and create a more logical interface.

title: Revert "AES: Use SSE2-based implementation as the fallback on x86 and x86-64."
body:
This reverts commit 1a5ad00222405b8e64ee322c61942bdd63cc1e29.

Not all C compilers for i686 support SSE2 by default.

title: ARM & Aarch64: Add ability to disable hardware crypto for testing.
Fix the encoding of `Ed25519KeyPair::generate_pkcs8()`'s output
body: Fixes #1464.

title: Add support for 64-bit big-endian PowerPC.
body: Not added to CI. We need to find a better solution for supporting PowerPC (and s390x and other less-common archs) in CI.

title: Expand 32-bit ARM test coverage
body: See individual commit messages for details.

title: CPU: ARM: Remove bogus static assertion about 32-bit ARM.
body: It is possible that a 32-bit ARM target could have static crypto CPU features.

title: NFC: CPU: Clarify safety invariants around `OPENSSL_armcap_P`.
CI: Reduce size of `test-features` matrix to speed up CI.
Don't run `test` jobs on Beta or Nightly channels.
body: These are duplicated by `coverage` (temporarily) and the `features` tests. Do this to reduce the latency between submitting a PR and it passing CI. Right now we have so many jobs with the huge matrix and CI takes too long.

title: Bring back the `RsaKeyPair` name.
body: The original plan was to add RSA encryption/decryption to the next release but that plan has changed. To make it easier for people to upgrade, and to be consistent with the current state of the other signature algorithm keypair names, bring back the old name.

title: Remove the word "deprecated" From the `EcdsaKeyPair::sign` documentation
rsa: Use NonZero::new instead of new_unchecked
Revert "Document or remove some uses of `unsafe`"
body: Reverts briansmith/ring#1657

title: Document or remove some uses of `unsafe`
body:
Hey @briansmith, I'm happy to have this merged if it's in a state you're comfortable with, but I also know you were hesitant about taking another dependency. I'd be happy to make any changes or chat about the overall approach.

I can also remove the `derive` feature from `zerocopy` if you'd prefer; that's the bulk of the compilation time (zerocopy itself without the derive is a fairly small library). I'm not sure if compilation time is your primary concern, but I know it is for some crate authors.

title: 32-bit ARM AES-GCM: Fix use of BSAES.
body: See each individual commit message.

title: NFC: Move low-level Montgomery arithmetic out of `bigint`.
body:
When the `alloc` feature is disabled, on lesser-used targets we don't build `bigint` but we still need some of the Montgomery arithmetic.


```
git diff \
   HEAD^1:src/arithmetic/bigint/bn_mul_mont_fallback.rs \
   src/arithmetic/montgomery.rs
```

```
git diff \
   HEAD^1:src/arithmetic/bigint.rs \
   src/arithmetic/montgomery.rs
```

title: NFC: Remove unneeded `#cfg(...)` in digest_tests.rs
body: The code is always enabled since "wasm32" was spelled wrongly. Apparently the wasm-bindgen compatibility issue is no longer an issue.

title: Merge BoringSSL through 167f1760ddfeaea1ee1a671ca88aafcccfe30ee0
body: This is a no-op merge. More merges are coming.

title: Prepare for next BoringSSL merge
body: This is the first two commits from #1643, without the third merge commit. By splitting this out, GitHub will let me do a "rebase" onto main instead of a merge. (Historically, all commits to *ring* get rebased onto main to make the majority of the history investigation simpler. The exception is merges from BoringSSL; these are done as merges to preserve authorship and to make comparison between *ring* and BoringSSL easier.)

title: Merge BoringSSL 13c9d5c69d04485a7a8840c12185c832026c8315
body: This is split out from the rest of the merge because it is a non-trivial merge. Best reviewed commit-by-commit.

title: NFC: Split internal `bigint` module into submodules
body:
The primary goal of this change is to make progress towards a better `arithmetic` API that abstracts over the storage (`BoxedLimbs`, etc.) to better facilitate doing more arithmetic in Rust instead of C, and to reduce the amount of heap allocation done for RSA operations.

The secondary goal is to unblock the merge of the most recent BoringSSL changes into *ring*. This is an issue only accidentally due to the timing of when I last merged BoringSSL into *ring* vs. when I made these changes.

title: Add support for PS Vita (armv7-sony-vita-newlibeabihf)
body: Fixes compilation for the target, random is provided by rust-random/getrandom#359

title: CI: Use 1.60.0 as MSRV for "features" test jobs too.
CI: (Temporarily?) remove mipsel-unknown-linux-gnu from build matrix.
body:
The CI jobs for this target are failing with this error:
```
error: component 'rust-std' for target 'mipsel-unknown-linux-gnu' is
unavailable for download for channel 'nightly'
```

Remove the target while we investigate.

title: CI: Use LLVM 16 tools.
body: Rust now uses LLVM 16 and writes object files that LLVM 15's `nm` cannot fully understand.

title: Add support for LoongArch64
body: Follow up https://github.com/briansmith/ring/pull/1565

title: Add support and CI workflow for riscv64
body:
As there's been few recent activity on related PRs, this is #1574 rebased on latest `main` with:
* git commit-attribution to involved developers and
* sanetized commit messages to match the naming used by ring

Tested and working on Alpine Linux (riscv64 with musl libc).

title: Let cc-rs choose the correct optimization flags for MSVC (`/O2` instead of `/Ox`)
body:
`/Ox` is widely misunderstood to be the flag to enable maximum optimization with MSVC, partly because it used to be called "Full optimzation" in the Visual Studio GUI (it has been changed and now it's called "Optimizations" or "Enable Most Speed Optimizations" which describes it better). The flag to enable maximum optimizaitions however is actually `/O2` ("Maximize Speed"), which was and still is the default flag for release builds in Visual Studio.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/build/reference/ox-full-optimization?view=msvc-170
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5063334/what-is-the-difference-between-the-ox-and-o2-compiler-options

If the intention was indeed to have `/O2` minus the flags `/Ox` is missing I would suggest adding a comment

title: deps: Move from `winapi` to `windows-sys`
body:
`winapi` is in maintenance mode and the new blessed way to access Windows APIs are the `windows`
and `windows-sys` crates. I don't think any types of `winapi` were exposed in the public API so
I used `windows-sys` since it has much faster compile times.

title: Fix `build.rs`: Use `env::var_os` to retrieve `Path`
body:
- Fix retrieveing `OUT_DIR` in `build.rs`
 - Fix getting `CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR`: Use `env::var_os`
 - Modify `run_command_with_args` to take `OsStr` instead of `String` for args
 - Call `env::var_os` in `read_env_var`
 - Change return type to `PathBuf` instead of `String` for fn `compile`

Signed-off-by: Jiahao XU <Jiahao_XU@outlook.com>

title: Fix broken URL in PKCS#8 docs
body: The extra period breaks the URL.

title: Use `cfg!(target_feature)` for static ARM/AARCH64 feature detection.
body: Our MSRV supports `if` in const expressions. Implement a workaround for buggy detection on older versions of Rust.

title: Allow accessing signature::UnparsedPublicKey bytes
body:
Implement `AsRef<[u8]>` for `signature::UnparsedPublicKey`, making it
possible to access the bytes of the public key. For consistency, I did
the same for `agreement::UnparsedPublicKey`, although it already has a
`bytes` method. `agreement::PublicKey` already uses the `AsRef<[u8]>`
approach.

Also, add missing `Debug` implementation ~and `algorithm` method~ for
`signature::UnparsedPublicKey`.

I agree to license my contributions to each file under the terms given
at the top of each file I changed.

title: AES: Use SSE2-based implementation as the fallback on x86 and x86-64.
body:
Address some warnings from Clang/GCC in the SSE2 code that are disabled
by default in BoringSSL but not in *ring*.
